articles.headline: Uber and Waymo Settle Trade Secrets Suit Over Driverless Cars
articles.snippet: Uber’s chief, Dara Khosrowshahi, said the company had not stolen trade secrets from the self-driving car unit of Google’s parent company, but expressed “regret for the actions” that led to the suit.
articles.abstract: Uber’s chief, Dara Khosrowshahi, said the company had not stolen trade secrets from the self-driving car unit of Google’s parent company, but expressed “regret for the actions” that led to the suit.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Waymo and Uber settled their legal fight on Friday, nearly a year after Waymo first accused the ride-hailing company of plotting to steal important self-driving car technology.

articles.headline: Kelly Says He’s Willing to Resign as Abuse Scandal Roils White House
articles.snippet: A resignation by the chief of staff, John F. Kelly, was not considered imminent, but his suggestion reflects the turmoil engulfing President Trump’s staff.
articles.abstract: A resignation by the chief of staff, John F. Kelly, was not considered imminent, but his suggestion reflects the turmoil engulfing President Trump’s staff.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — John F. Kelly, the White House chief of staff, told officials in the West Wing on Friday that he was willing to step down over his handling of allegations of spousal abuse against Rob Porter, the staff secretary who resigned in disgrace this week over the accusations, according to two officials aware of the discussions.
articles.byline: By Maggie Haberman, Julie Hirschfeld Davis and Michael S. Schmidt

articles.headline: Facial Recognition Is Accurate, if You’re a White Guy
articles.snippet: Commercial software is nearly flawless at telling the gender of white men, a new study says. But not so for darker-skinned women.
articles.abstract: Commercial software is nearly flawless at telling the gender of white men, a new study says. But not so for darker-skinned women.
articles.lead_paragraph: Facial recognition technology is improving by leaps and bounds. Some commercial software can now tell the gender of a person in a photograph.

articles.headline: U.S. Spies, Seeking to Retrieve Cyberweapons, Paid Russian Peddling Trump Secrets
articles.snippet: After months of negotiations, the Russian insisted on including information about the president as part of a deal involving stolen hacking tools.
articles.abstract: After months of negotiations, the Russian insisted on including information about the president as part of a deal involving stolen hacking tools.
articles.lead_paragraph: BERLIN — After months of secret negotiations, a shadowy Russian bilked American spies out of $100,000 last year, promising to deliver stolen National Security Agency cyberweapons in a deal that he insisted would also include compromising material on President Trump, according to American and European intelligence officials.

articles.headline: Kim Jong-un Invites South Korean Leader to North for Summit Meeting
articles.snippet: After North Korea’s leader relayed the proposal through his sister, President Moon Jae-in said the Koreas should “create the environment to make it happen.”
articles.abstract: After North Korea’s leader relayed the proposal through his sister, President Moon Jae-in said the Koreas should “create the environment to make it happen.”
articles.lead_paragraph: SEOUL, South Korea — North Korea’s reclusive leader, Kim Jong-un, extended an extremely rare invitation to a foreign head of state on Saturday, using the diplomatic opening created by the Olympics in South Korea to ask its leader, President Moon Jae-in, to visit the North for a summit meeting.

articles.headline: The Trump Tax Cuts Hurt This Manufacturer. It Kept On Lobbying.
articles.snippet: Hundreds of companies were hurt by the Trump tax cuts, which failed to extend dozens of expiring tax credits. Executives at Plug Power never lost hope.
articles.abstract: Hundreds of companies were hurt by the Trump tax cuts, which failed to extend dozens of expiring tax credits. Executives at Plug Power never lost hope.
articles.lead_paragraph: LATHAM, N.Y. — By noon on Wednesday, the snow was ankle-deep in the parking lot and the workers had abandoned the factory floor at Plug Power to escape the storm. Hydrogen-powered fuel cells meant for forklifts in Amazon or Walmart warehouses sat half-finished in steel casings.

articles.headline: Trump Blocks Release of Memo Rebutting Republican Claims
articles.snippet: President Trump blocked the release of a classified Democratic memo, setting up a potential showdown with Congress over the fate of its contents.
articles.abstract: President Trump blocked the release of a classified Democratic memo, setting up a potential showdown with Congress over the fate of its contents.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump on Friday blocked the release of a classified Democratic memo rebutting Republican claims that top federal law enforcement officials had abused their powers in spying on a former Trump campaign aide, a move that Democrats denounced as politically motivated hypocrisy.
articles.byline: By Michael D. Shear and Nicholas Fandos

articles.headline: One Cause of Market Turbulence: Computer-Driven Index Funds
articles.snippet: The rise of passive investing over the past decade fueled the stock market’s historic boom. Now it’s acting as an accelerant as markets decline.
articles.abstract: The rise of passive investing over the past decade fueled the stock market’s historic boom. Now it’s acting as an accelerant as markets decline.
articles.lead_paragraph: A decade ago, the center of gravity on Wall Street were raucous trading desks and stock exchange floors. These days, the locus has shifted to far quieter places, where computers are in charge.

articles.headline: Inquiry of Soldiers’ Deaths Urges Curtailing West Africa Missions
articles.snippet: The Pentagon is poised to scale back patrols and commanders’ authorities as a result of the October ambush in Niger that killed four American soldiers.
articles.abstract: The Pentagon is poised to scale back patrols and commanders’ authorities as a result of the October ambush in Niger that killed four American soldiers.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — A draft military investigation into the deadly ambush of American soldiers in Niger in October calls for the Pentagon to scale back the number of ground missions in West Africa, and to strip commanders in the field of some authority to send troops on potentially high-risk patrols.
articles.byline: By Thomas Gibbons-Neff, Helene Cooper and Eric Schmitt

articles.headline: Israel Strikes Iran in Syria and Loses a Jet
articles.snippet: Israel said it had launched a major attack after its F-16 came under Syrian fire. The events appeared to be Israel’s first direct engagement with Iranian forces in Syrian territory.
articles.abstract: Israel said it had launched a major attack after its F-16 came under Syrian fire. The events appeared to be Israel’s first direct engagement with Iranian forces in Syrian territory.
articles.lead_paragraph: JERUSALEM — Israel clashed with Syrian and Iranian military forces on Saturday in a series of audacious cross-border strikes that could mark a dangerous new phase in Syria’s long civil war.
articles.byline: By Isabel Kershner, Anne Barnard and Eric Schmitt

articles.headline: Before There Was #MeToo, There Was Mary Cunningham
articles.snippet: In the 1980s, Ms. Cunningham and Bill Agee were the central figures in one of the most famous sex scandals in corporate America. Four decades later, she sees it as one of the first #MeToo moments.
articles.abstract: In the 1980s, Ms. Cunningham and Bill Agee were the central figures in one of the most famous sex scandals in corporate America. Four decades later, she sees it as one of the first #MeToo moments.
articles.lead_paragraph: In the tightknit community of St. Helena, Calif., Mary Cunningham Agee is known as the Tomato Lady. She grows the best heirlooms, giving them out, along with basil, cabbage and cauliflower, to her Napa Valley neighbors. Vineyards line both sides of her 4,000-square-foot farmhouse, the one with the soft golden-white hue and the shutters with heart-shaped cutouts. Ms. Cunningham Agee tends to the grapes to produce 25 cases of pinot noir each season.

articles.headline: His 2020 Campaign Message: The Robots Are Coming
articles.snippet: Andrew Yang, a former tech executive, is mounting a longer-than-long-shot bid for the White House by warning of economic calamity ahead.
articles.abstract: Andrew Yang, a former tech executive, is mounting a longer-than-long-shot bid for the White House by warning of economic calamity ahead.
articles.lead_paragraph: Among the many, many Democrats who will seek the party’s presidential nomination in 2020, most probably agree on a handful of core issues: protecting DACA, rejoining the Paris climate agreement, unraveling President Trump’s tax breaks for the wealthy.

articles.headline: G.O.P. Squirms as Trump Veers Off Script With Abuse Remarks
articles.snippet: On Saturday he appeared to ignore victims of sexual abuse and express doubts about the #MeToo movement, saying, “lives are being shattered and destroyed by a mere allegation.”
articles.abstract: On Saturday he appeared to ignore victims of sexual abuse and express doubts about the #MeToo movement, saying, “lives are being shattered and destroyed by a mere allegation.”
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump’s approval ratings have been nudging upward and his party’s political standing is improving, but the president’s unceasing habit of making inflammatory and insensitive remarks is galvanizing opposition against him — especially from women — that could smother Republican momentum going into the midterm campaign.
articles.byline: By Jonathan Martin and Alexander Burns

articles.headline: Where Did Your Pay Raise Go? It May Have Become a Bonus
articles.snippet: One-time rewards now consume a bigger portion of payroll budgets than salary increases that deliver longer-term returns.
articles.abstract: One-time rewards now consume a bigger portion of payroll budgets than salary increases that deliver longer-term returns.
articles.lead_paragraph: The recent stock market rumpus has been set off in part by fears that a tight labor market and quickening wage growth are a foretaste of higher inflation and interest rates. But sustained raises for American workers may be possible only if employers can break a habit: handing out one-time bonuses in place of salary increases.

articles.headline: Latino Business Group Considers Harassment Allegations Against C.E.O.
articles.snippet: Hispanic Chamber of Commerce head Javier Palomarez is accused of sexual harassment and financial misconduct. On Sunday, his board reviewed the claims, which he denies.
articles.abstract: Hispanic Chamber of Commerce head Javier Palomarez is accused of sexual harassment and financial misconduct. On Sunday, his board reviewed the claims, which he denies.
articles.lead_paragraph: Directors of an influential Latino business organization met on Sunday to discuss allegations that their chief executive had engaged in sexual harassment and financial impropriety, according to people close to the board.

articles.headline: As West Fears the Rise of Autocrats, Hungary Shows What’s Possible
articles.snippet: Prime Minister Viktor Orban has remade the country’s political system and pioneered a model of one-party rule. His actions can be seen as part of a broader decline of democracy.
articles.abstract: Prime Minister Viktor Orban has remade the country’s political system and pioneered a model of one-party rule. His actions can be seen as part of a broader decline of democracy.
articles.lead_paragraph: BUDAPEST — The senior leaders of Fidesz gathered on the banks of the Danube, in a building known as the Hungarian White House, stunned by the scale of their good fortune. Their right-wing party had won unexpectedly sweeping political power in national elections. The question was how to use it.

articles.headline: With Qualcomm in Play, San Diego Fears Losing ‘Our Flag’
articles.snippet: The world’s No. 1 maker of smartphone chips is the area’s biggest employer and benefactor, a role threatened by Broadcom’s $121 billion takeover bid.
articles.abstract: The world’s No. 1 maker of smartphone chips is the area’s biggest employer and benefactor, a role threatened by Broadcom’s $121 billion takeover bid.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN DIEGO — For corporate success, no story in San Diego is as good as the story of Qualcomm. The company was founded in a living room and became the world’s largest maker of smartphone chips, one of the area’s largest employers and its chief corporate benefactor.

articles.headline: Nancy Pelosi Wants to Take Back the House. But She Faces a More Urgent Test.
articles.snippet: At 77, Ms. Pelosi remains a dominant figure in Washington. How she bridges Democrats’ factions on immigration may help determine whether she can lead her party to a majority.
articles.abstract: At 77, Ms. Pelosi remains a dominant figure in Washington. How she bridges Democrats’ factions on immigration may help determine whether she can lead her party to a majority.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — As Congress barreled toward a government shutdown Thursday evening, Representative Nancy Pelosi, the Californian who has led House Democrats for 15 years, gathered her troops to urge them to vote no on a spending bill that would keep the government open.

articles.headline: With Gaza in Financial Crisis, Fears That ‘an Explosion’s Coming’
articles.snippet: A standoff between Hamas and the Palestinian Authority is ravaging Gaza’s economy, pushing it to the verge of collapse, and escalating the risk of a violent confrontation with Israel.
articles.abstract: A standoff between Hamas and the Palestinian Authority is ravaging Gaza’s economy, pushing it to the verge of collapse, and escalating the risk of a violent confrontation with Israel.
articles.lead_paragraph: GAZA CITY — The payday line at a downtown A.T.M. here in Gaza City was dozens deep with government clerks and pensioners, waiting to get what cash they could.

articles.headline: Weinstein Company Sale Delayed by N.Y. Attorney General Lawsuit
articles.snippet: Eric T. Schneiderman filed a suit alleging the studio and its founders violated state and city laws barring gender discrimination and sexual harassment.
articles.abstract: Eric T. Schneiderman filed a suit alleging the studio and its founders violated state and city laws barring gender discrimination and sexual harassment.
articles.lead_paragraph: The fire sale of the Weinstein Company hit a last-minute snag on Sunday, when Eric T. Schneiderman, New York’s attorney general, filed a lawsuit against the studio and its fraternal founders alleging that they repeatedly violated state and city laws barring gender discrimination, sexual harassment, sexual abuse and coercion.
articles.byline: By Brooks Barnes and William Neuman

articles.headline: Abuse Case Exposes Fissures in a White House in Turmoil
articles.snippet: Aides to President Trump said they remained confused and upset over the handling of the accusations against Rob Porter, the staff secretary who stepped down.
articles.abstract: Aides to President Trump said they remained confused and upset over the handling of the accusations against Rob Porter, the staff secretary who stepped down.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The furor over spousal abuse allegations that forced the resignation of one of President Trump’s top advisers last week has exposed fissures within the White House that had been papered over since John F. Kelly took over last summer as chief of staff with a mandate to end the dysfunction.
articles.byline: By Peter Baker and Maggie Haberman

articles.headline: Planners of Deadly Charlottesville Rally Are Tested in Court
articles.snippet: People injured at the alt-right rally in Charlottesville, Va., say in a lawsuit that organizers conspired to incite violence. The defendants say the First Amendment protects them.
articles.abstract: People injured at the alt-right rally in Charlottesville, Va., say in a lawsuit that organizers conspired to incite violence. The defendants say the First Amendment protects them.
articles.lead_paragraph: In the hours after last summer’s white power rally in Charlottesville, Va., erupted into violence, the planners of the protest mounted a defense: While much of the country may have found their racist chants and Nazi iconography deplorable, they claimed that they had a First Amendment right to self-expression, and that none of the bloodshed was actually their fault.

articles.headline: White House Proposes $4.4 Trillion Budget That Adds $7 Trillion to Deficits
articles.snippet: The White House released a proposed budget that is largely irrelevant, given Congress passed a spending bill last week that outlines priorities.
articles.abstract: The White House released a proposed budget that is largely irrelevant, given Congress passed a spending bill last week that outlines priorities.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump sent Congress a $4.4 trillion budget proposal on Monday outlining steep cuts to domestic programs, large increases in military spending and a ballooning federal deficit that illustrates how far Republicans have strayed from their longtime embrace of balanced budgets.
